comments: Professor Kronmiller was pretty average in his lectures, as he uses a power point slide for each of them. He was super funny though so it made class fun. He gives you extra credit for answering questions in class. You can follow along easily and he is really flexible and helpful anytime you miss class. If you semi-try, you\'ll pass with an A

comments: He was awesome. Very Funny, but does tend to tell a lot of stories, sometimes gets off topic a tad. He has 3 assignments, and 3 tests, he gives extra credit just for coming to class & answering questions from the reading you need to do. If you study & work hard, it\'s an easy class. Miss class, be sure & get notes from someone else!

comments: Jay is HILARIOUS. The course consisted of 3 short assignments and 3 tests. He does send out a study guide before each test and will stay after class to review with those who would like to go over it. He does offer extra credit if he calls your name from a stack of cards and you are present and another if you answer his questions about the reading.

comments: There are only 3 assignments and 3 tests. The tests are not cumulative. Kronmiller is the funniest professor out there. If you want to go to a comedy club and get credit for it, go to his class. He can be serious, but tries to make memorable way to remember history. No date memorization either.

comments: Kronmiller is an amazing instructor, he is highly knowledgeable, and intelligent, he knows exactly how to make history interesting, and something you want to learn about. His class is an easy A as long as you show up, and complete the provided study guides. Extra credit is offered for attendance. I highly recommend this instructor to everyone.

comments: Kronmiller is hilarious! He made history very fun with his corky and sometimes unappropiate jokes. Be sure to be present and take good notes, tests are based off of study guide in which you can get your answers from your notes and your reading assignments. I would of gotten an A- but this was the class I\'d least try hard in.

comments: Kronmiller is just a really chill professor. Pros: The workload was relatively small, there were no essays, and the final was non-cumulative. Every lecture had some sort of humor in it, and he really enjoys the material. Cons: He can get a little unreliable, showing up to class 10-15 minutes late, and he can be hard to contact outside of class.

comments: Professor Kronmiller was amazing! I have never enjoyed a history class more then Kronmiller\'s. He was able to make the material both interesting and entertaining. He offers extra credit if you are in class and if you can answer questions correctly based on the weekly readings. He provides outlines/study guides for tests which really help.

comments: Jay is the funniest and most helpful teacher I\'ve had at Weber State! I took history from Sara Dant and Gene Sessions in the past, and their teaching methods SUCK. Their classes were so boring and not to mention extremely difficult.. Luckily, Jay\'s is the complete opposite! With this class, I was finally able to pass history! Recommend him 110%.
